abstract: In a press conference late Thursday in Palo Alto, Calif., the companies announced they would cooperate on the development of electric cars.
snippet: In a press conference late Thursday in Palo Alto, Calif., the companies announced they would cooperate on the development of electric cars.
lead_paragraph: Tesla Motors and Toyota Motor have announced that Tesla has bought the recently closed Nummi assembly plant in Fremont, California, where it intends to make its Model S luxury electric sedan and other future models.

headline.main: Electric Car Agreement for Toyota and Tesla
headline.print_headline: Electric Car Agreement For Toyota And Tesla

abstract: An independent engineering firm was actually hired by a law firm to do research that would be used to defend the carmaker, officials said.
snippet: An independent engineering firm was actually hired by a law firm to do research that would be used to defend the carmaker, officials said.
lead_paragraph: In February, at the height of the Toyota recall crisis, company officials told Congressional investigators that they had hired an independent engineering firm to study the instances of sudden acceleration.

headline.main: Lawmakers Cast Doubt on Report That Toyota Called Independent
headline.print_headline: Lawmakers Cast Doubt on Report That Toyota Called Independent

abstract: Tesla Motors and Toyota Motor announced on Thursday that Tesla had bought the recently closed Nummi assembly plant in Fremont, Calif., where it intends to make its Model S luxury electric sedan and other future models.

lead_paragraph: Tesla Motors and Toyota Motor announced on Thursday that Tesla had bought the recently closed Nummi assembly plant in Fremont, Calif., where it intends to make its Model S luxury electric sedan and other future models.

headline.main: Toyota and Tesla to Partner on Electric Cars

abstract: Fears that the fragile economic recovery in the United States might be threatened by the financial and political crisis in Europe gripped Wall Street on Thursday, sending the stock market into a sharp decline and leaving anxious traders wondering where the pain might stop.
snippet: Fears that the fragile economic recovery in the United States might be threatened by the financial and political crisis in Europe gripped Wall Street on Thursday, sending the stock market into a sharp decline and leaving anxious traders wondering ...
lead_paragraph: Stock markets in Asia fell sharply in early trading on Friday after continuing declines on Wall Street and in Europe.

headline.main: Asian Stocks Drop Sharply After Big Fall in U.S.
